text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Israeli newspapers on Tuesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
JERUSALEM POST
- French President Jacques Chirac: Only a Palestinian state will bring security to Israel.
- U.S. peace envoy Dennis Ross leaves as Hebron talks stall.
- Syria: We're ready for war if Israeli provocations continue.
- Government in tact despite successful vote of no confidence.
- Report: Israel Air Force scrambled jets on Syrian front 11 days ago.
- Dead Sea Works may be split up.
- National Infrastructure Minister Ariel Sharon to explore plan for Israel Lands to sell government real estate.
- Shekel depreciates to 3.27 against dollar.
- Cairo summit will host ministers, but not prime ministers.
- Finance Minister Dan Meridor seeks fiscal restraint mechanism.
- Labour and Social Affairs Minister Eli Yishai intends to restrict the number of permits for people who want to work on the Jewish sabbath.
- Vishay Intertechnology cancels plans for Ofakim plant, citing government red tape.
GLOBES
- Meridor: In 1997 a method for coordinating budget spending to tax income.
HAARETZ
- Palestinian's body found in car near Ramallah; circumstances of his death unclear.
- Increasing fear in Israel of a military confrontation with Syria, after U.S. elections.
- Government submits to Knesset "Norwegian law" on cabinet ministers leaving parliament; vote next week.
- Opposition victory in no-confidence vote doesn't topple government because new law requires simple majority of 61-59.
YEDIOTH AHRONOTH
- Meridor expects another budget cut will be required in 1997 budget.
- Palestinian President Yasser Arafat's secret reports, faxed by his security chiefs, reach settler by mistake: "French president's visit should be exploited to put European pressure on Israel."
- Ross's departure for Washington brings about a breakthrough in negotiations.
- Rupert Murdoch tells Yedioth Ahronoth: "I am ready to answer any question of the investigators from Israel."
- 56 percent of Israelis have a headache at least once every three months.
MAARIV
- Israel: Arafat is purposely delaying completion of the negotiations on Hebron.
